questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
When you are in the driving seat of a car, you have the steering and the horn in your hands, the brake and accelerator under your feet, eyes open looking ahead, left and right. The same can be said about a motorcycle rider, with some modifications. These are all very visible. But, behind all, there is something that keeps working unseen. And that is the Central Processing Unit (CPU), your brain. CPUS are artificially intelligent machines that are programmed to do specific jobs under fixed conditions and judgements. But the human brain is intelligent by nature. It is the most sophisticated machine that is able to operate on ever-changing conditions and standards of judgement. As conditions in the traffic keep invariably changing, this virtue of sophistication of your brain must be at work when you are driving. The difference between traffic in the roads and highways and racing circuit must not be blurring inside you. Never imagine yourself to be a Michael Schumacher driving an F − 1 \mathrm{F}-1 F − 1 at 300 m p h 300 \mathrm{mph} 300 mph . Leave no room for fantasy. You must always be ready to encounter unexpected behavior from any vehicle or pedestrian. 'Keep your cool' is easy to advice but difficult to maintain. Still you must always restrain yourself because, at the end of the day, you don't want to be regarded as a killer. Now you see, the last thing that differentiates you from a computer is your conscience.

sub_questions.explanation:
Summary
There are some works like driving a car or a motorcycle, which are visible. But there is something that keeps working unseen and that is the Central Processing Unit (CPU), our brain. Our brain, which is intelligent by nature, works behind the screen while CPUs are artificially intelligent. It is the most sophisticated machine operating on ever-changing conditions and standards, of judgement. Conditions in the traffic keep invariably changing and our brain must work at the time of our driving. We should be realistic and as such should not rely on imagination. And we should always remain careful about unexpected behaviour from others on the road. Still we must restrain ourselves as we do not want to be regarded as a killer. Here is the difference between a computer and us. And our conscience makes the difference.

Write a summary of the following text:
Universities should never be made into mechanical organizations for collecting and distributing knowledge. Through them the people should offer their intellectual hospitality, their wealth of mind to others, and earn their proud right in return to receive gifts from the rest of the world. But in the whole length and breadth of India there is not a single university established in the modern time where a foreign or an Indian student can properly be acquainted with the best products of the Indian mind. For that we have to cross the sea, and knock at the doors of France and Germany. Educational institutions in our country are India's alms-bowl of knowledge; they lower our intellectual self-respect; they encourage us to make a foolish display of decorations composed of borrowed feathers.

sub_questions.explanation: Universities should never be just institutions for gathering and spreading knowledge. Rather, they should be the means for people to offer their intellectual hospitality and worth of mind to others, and obtain gifts from the rest of the world. Unfortunately, India lacks such university. So, Indian students are to knock at the doors of the European universities. Thus, Indian educational institutions have turned into the country’s alms-bowl of knowledge, lowering their intellectual self-respect and encouraging them to imitate others.

questions.uddipok: Write a composition on adulteration of foodstuff with clear references to the causes and consequences.

sub_questions.explanation:
Adulteration of Foodstuff: Causes and Consequences
Adulteration of foodstuff refers to the practice of intentionally adding harmful, low-quality, or synthetic substances to food items in order to increase profits. It is a serious issue that affects public health and undermines consumer trust. Adulterated food is often cheaper to produce but can pose significant health risks to those who consume it unknowingly.
Causes of Food Adulteration
One of the primary causes of food adulteration is the economic motive behind it. Sellers and manufacturers may use adulterants to increase the quantity or shelf life of food products, thereby reducing costs. For example, low-quality or artificial substances are often added to increase the weight of spices, grains, or beverages. This is especially common in the case of products like milk, tea, sugar, and edible oils.
The lack of stringent regulations and enforcement also contributes to the prevalence of food adulteration. In many countries, food safety laws are not strictly implemented, allowing unscrupulous traders to exploit gaps in the system. In some cases, poor awareness among consumers about food safety and quality standards makes it easier for adulterated food to enter the market without detection.
Another significant cause is the greed of certain manufacturers and traders. In their quest for higher profits, they compromise on quality and safety. For instance, chemicals, artificial colorants, and preservatives are added to food items like fruits, vegetables, and sweets to make them look fresh and appealing, despite the potential health risks they pose.
Consequences of Food Adulteration
The consequences of food adulteration are severe and can have both short-term and long-term effects on health. Immediate reactions to consuming adulterated food can include food poisoning, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea, which can be particularly dangerous for children and the elderly.
Long-term consumption of adulterated food can lead to chronic health problems, such as liver and kidney damage, cancer, and reproductive issues. For instance, the addition of harmful chemicals like formalin in fish or milk can lead to severe health complications over time. The accumulation of toxic substances in the body can weaken the immune system, making individuals more susceptible to diseases.
In addition to health risks, food adulteration also leads to economic losses for consumers. People pay for food products that are often less nutritious or potentially harmful. This can cause financial strain, especially in lower-income communities where access to safe food is already limited.
Moreover, food adulteration damages the reputation of businesses and industries that rely on consumer trust. Once a brand is associated with adulterated food, it can lose its customers and face legal consequences, leading to long-term financial losses.
Conclusion
In conclusion, food adulteration is a harmful practice with far-reaching consequences. The causes are multifaceted, including economic motives, lack of regulation, and consumer ignorance. The effects on health and the economy are undeniable, making it imperative for governments to enforce strict food safety regulations and for consumers to remain vigilant. Only through collective efforts can we ensure that the food we consume is safe, nutritious, and free from harmful adulterants.

questions.uddipok:
The following is the beginning of a story. Complete it in your own words:
Once upon a time, there lived a dove. It was passing its days happily. One day, while he was sitting on a tree beside a river, he saw an ant ........

sub_questions.explanation:
Once upon a time a river ran through a green field. There lived an ant beside the stream. One day the ant went to stream to drink water. While drinking water, suddenly the ant fell into the running water.
“Help! Help!” shouted the ant. But no one heard him. A dove was sitting on a tree near the stream and saw the miserable condition of the ant. The dove felt pity.
Very quickly the dove broke off a wide leaf and throw nearer to the ant. The little ant climbed onto the leaf. Soon the leaf struck in some reeds and the ant climbed onto the bank. What a lucky escape!
After a few days the ant was looking for food beside the stream. He stood still hearing the cooing of a dove. The ant saw that it was the same dove that saved his life. It was very happy to see the dove and wanted to show his gratefulness by waving but of no use.
Then to his utter horror he found a hunter carrying a bow and an arrow. The hunter quietly drew took his gun and aimed at the dove. Just at that moment the ant bit very seriously on the hunter’s leg. So, the hunter’s aim failed and it hit a branch of the tree. The dove flapped her wings and flew off in a hurry.

The hunter bent down to look. There was a tiny red mark on his leg. And the ant? It was nowhere to bee seen!

I must say, witnessing your growth and success fills me with immense joy and inspiration. questions.uddipok:
Write down the theme of the following poem (not more than 50 words) :
Time, you old gipsy man,
Will you not stay,
Put up your caravan
Just for one day?
All things I'll give you
Will you be my guest
Bells for your jennet
Of silver the best.
…………………………………….
Goldsmiths shall beat you
A great golden ring,
Peacocks will bow to you,
Little boys sing,
Oh, and sweet girls will
Festoon you with may.
Time, you old gipsy,
Why hasten away?

sub_questions.explanation: Theme: The central theme of the poem is the importance of time. Time waits for none. The poet implies that if we don't make the best use of time, we will never get it back. Time once lost is lost forever. A person can only be successful in life if he/she values time and uses it properly.
